interactions: SaaS Jira - issue key CARESMM-9956 // Service Sfit commented: ✅ QC PASSED━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━📋 Incident Analysis SummaryThe incident involved multiple reports of customers being unable to initiate chats via widgets on their websites, traced to expired SSL certificates for Brand Messenger services in the usw2 and euw1 regions. The expired certificates caused SSLCertVerificationError messages and failed HTTPS connections, disrupting customer chat functionalities.🚀 Resolution EffectivenessRoot Cause: The root cause was clearly identified as expired SSL certificates on the AWS ALB for Brand Messenger services.Actions Taken: New SSL certificates were generated and updated in AWS ACM for both usw2 and euw1 regions. The certificates were committed to the repository, uploaded, and attached to the load balancers. Post-update verification confirmed the resolution.Evidence: The resolution is supported by logs showing SSLCertVerificationError messages, comments detailing the certificate renewal process, and openssl verification confirming the new certificates' validity through July 2026.Monitoring: The incident was detected through customer reports rather than automated monitoring. A ticket should be created in the MONAUTO project to enhance monitoring for SSL certificate expirations.Non-Execution: Not applicable, as the resolution was executed successfully.📝 Process AdherenceCommunication: The communication in the comments and resolution summary was clear and timely, detailing the steps taken and confirming resolution.Documentation: The documentation was comprehensive, including logs, screenshots, and detailed comments on the resolution process.Runbook Usage/Creation: There is no mention of a runbook. Given the nature of the incident, a runbook should be created to guide future SSL certificate renewals and prevent similar incidents.📊 MetricsInvestigation Quality: 5/5 (The root cause analysis was thorough and accurate.)Documentation Quality: 5/5 (Comments and resolution summary were clear and complete.)Resolution Effectiveness: 5/5 (Actions taken were effective and supported by evidence.)Total score: 15/15💡 Suggestions for Improvement1. Implement automated monitoring for SSL certificate expirations to prevent similar incidents.2. Create a runbook for SSL certificate management, including renewal processes and verification steps.3. Enhance communication protocols to ensure timely detection and reporting of similar issues.✅ Final AssessmentThis analysis was performed to ensure quality and completeness.

Kayako - ticket id 60234621 // Chintan Parekh commented publicly: Dear Customer,

We have identified the cause of the chat widget outage and implemented a fix. Our team will continue to monitor the system closely to ensure everything remains stable and no further issues occur.

Kayako - ticket id 60234621 // Chintan Parekh commented privately: An outage affecting Brand Messenger customer chat widgets was traced to an expired SSL certificate on brandmessenger.usw2.khoros.com, resulting in SSLCertVerificationError messages and failed HTTPS connections. Investigation confirmed that the AWS ALB was still serving an expired GoDaddy-issued certificate. New Starfield (GoDaddy Group) certificates were generated for both usw2 and euw1 regions (brandmessenger.usw2.khoros.com.71ff5-active and brandmessenger.euw1.khoros.com.06f1b-active), committed to the repository, and successfully uploaded and attached in AWS ACM. Post-update verification using openssl confirmed that the renewed certificates (valid through July 2026) are now active on the load balancers, restoring secure connectivity and resolving all customer chat access issues.

SaaS Jira - issue key CARESMM-9956 // Muhammad Waqar commented: An outage affecting Brand Messenger customer chat widgets was traced to an expired SSL certificate on brandmessenger.usw2.khoros.com, resulting in SSLCertVerificationError messages and failed HTTPS connections. Investigation confirmed that the AWS ALB was still serving an expired GoDaddy-issued certificate. New Starfield (GoDaddy Group) certificates were generated for both usw2 and euw1 regions (brandmessenger.usw2.khoros.com.71ff5-active and brandmessenger.euw1.khoros.com.06f1b-active), committed to the repository, and successfully uploaded and attached in AWS ACM. Post-update verification using openssl confirmed that the renewed certificates (valid through July 2026) are now active on the load balancers, restoring secure connectivity and resolving all customer chat access issues.
